newsitem.title: CANADA: Commercials sell WCE canola, funds buy July-Nov.
newsitem.headline: Commercials sell WCE canola, funds buy July-Nov.

text.p: WCE canola ended down on commercial sales, funds bought July-Nov spread, traders said.

"Funds bought most of the 1,700 July-Nov, commercials sold all contracts. Cargill bought 400 November, 100 every 50 cents down from C$365.50," a trader said. July WCE futures crush margin rose to -4.60 Thursday from -8.94 Wednesday. July-Nov spread $41 to $40. Volume was 7,075 lots, or 141,500 tonnes.
July canola lost $1.80 to $403.90, November down $2.70 to $364.30. July flax lost $2.20 to $333.60 on commercial selling, November down $1.40 to $316.10.
"Weather's in the back of everyone's mind," a trader said.
The Canadian Wheat Board cut Prairie wheat yields by 0.5 bushels an acre on Wednesday due to lack of rain in the southeastern Prairies.
July western barley lost $0.30 to $131.30 as Alberta Wheat Pool liquidated July longs and bought October down $0.20 to $133.30, a trader said. July-Dec spread at $3. Volume was 260.
July wheat down $2.50 at $155.50, December down $1.10 to $158.50 as RBC-DS bought scale down. Volume was 475 lots.
July feed peas lost US$2 to US$182.50, October fell US$1.90 to US$181 as PCTS and RBC-DS bought. July-Oct US$1.
(All prices in Canadian dollars/tonne except oats, peas).
